results.title: Mission to Yenan
results.creator_credit: Peter F. Davis, Joe de Cola and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Relates the experiences of four former United States Foreign Service China specialists who foresaw the defeat of Chiang Kai-Shek and recommended, at end of World War II, that the United States adopt a more open-ended policy towards Communist China. Their advice was not headed then and they discuss their views in light of subsequent events in Asia.

results.title: Mission to no man's land
results.creator_credit: Georges Pessis, Stanley Wright, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: A tour of a typical Austrian refugee camp, showing something of the extent of the problem. Yul Brynner records interviews with the refugees. One particularly moving sequence shows an elderly refugee talking on the long distance telephone with his family in the United States.

results.title: Missiles of October
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Robert Berger, Herbert Brodkin and Viacom Enterprises
results.brief_description: A dramatic re-enactment of the twelve nerve-shattering days in October 1962, following the US discovery of Soviet missile bases in Cuba. The inner workings of government are revealed, as President John F. Kennedy and Nikita Khrushchev grapple with crisis diplomacy. Cast includes Ralph Bellamy, Howard da Silva, John Dehner, William Devane, Andrew Duggan, Dana Elcar, Larry Gates, James Olson, Nehemiah Persoff, William Prince, John Randolph and Martin Sheen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Page, Robert Berger, Herbert Brodkin and Viacom Enterprises

results.title: Missa Luba; Muungano National Choir, Kenya
results.brief_description: Filmed entirely on location in Kenya, this is a mass in Congolese (Zairean) style, for mixed chorus with soloist and percussion. In this performance, the tenor solo is sung by three tenor voices. The video incorporates scenes of Kenya, and recorded visits to some of the choir members’ home villages. The choir is conducted by Boniface Mganga.

results.title: Miss, Mrs, or Ms: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: Reports on the progress being made by feminist philosophies, showing that the stereotyping of traditional roles is decreasing in American society. Narrated by: Sylvia Chase, Christopher Glenn.

results.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
results.creator_credit: Curtis Bernhardt, Jerry Wald and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham’s “Rain”, a steamy story of sex, sin and salvation in the tropics. Set in the 1940s, it is the story of a bawdy nightclub entertainer, Sadie (Rita Hayworth) and Alfred Davidson (Jose Ferrer), a puritanical preacher waging an anti-sin campaign in the Pacific Islands. When Sadie falls in love with a straight-arrow marine (Aldo Ray), she seeks Davidson’s help in reforming her life. Tragically, the repressed cleric reacts with disbelief and, ultimately violence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Curtis Bernhardt, Jerry Wald and Columbia Pictures

results.title: Miss Nelson is missing (K)
results.creator_credit: Frank Gladstone, Richard Rosen, Learning Corporation of America and Synatrak
results.brief_description: Miss Nelson is the nicest teacher in the school but her students are the worst behaved. When she suddenly does not come to school, a substitute teacher, Miss Viola Swamp, appears instead. Miss Swamp immediately lays down the law - no talking, no goofing, no free time. The students immediately begin a search for Miss Nelson, realising how wonderful she really is. They get nowhere, and are grateful on the day Miss Nelson mysteriously reappears. Animated and based on the book by Harry Allard, illustrated by James Marshall.
